availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard Johnson Thomasson (Scott County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Delilah Thomasson. Married to Susan Hendrickson Thomasson. Father of Mary B. Thomasson, Louie Thomasson, and Annie Thomasson. Farmer in Scott County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Scott County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 1, p. 892.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 1, p. 216A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Forks of Elkhorn, p. 82B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994054, Scott County Births, p. 923.
"Richard Johnson Thomasson (1835-1907)," Find A Grave, Memorial 47491500, accessed October 13, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/47491500.
